cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 85 miles SSW of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: slowly turning northwest then north toward the central-southeastern Louisiana coast and the lower Mississippi Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the central Louisiana coast (around Morgan City/Intracoastal City)

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Mouth of the Mississippi River to Grand Isle and Intracoastal City to Cameron; Tropical Storm Watch east of Mouth of Pearl River to MS/AL border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Intracoastal City to Grand Isle; Tropical Storm Warning Mouth of the Pearl River to Grand Isle, Lake Pontchartrain/Lake Maurepas (including New Orleans), Intracoastal City to Cameron; Storm-Surge Warning Intracoastal City to Shell Beach
weather_observation.impacted_coast: north-central Gulf Coast, especially Louisiana and southwest Mississippi shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) possible with a 61 % chance; brief gusts to near 60 mph cannot be ruled out.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at the inland port, although river levels could be affected by coastal surge pushing up the Mississippi River.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches likely with locally higher totals, producing flash-flood and river-flood risk in the Baton Rouge area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Friday–Saturday; prolonged river flooding and possible power outages affecting port operations.
